alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 4:42PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...The Yukon and Porcupine River at Fort Yukon * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Water levels east of town by the gravel pits have slowly come up over the past several days, impacting the road by the Voc-Ed building and into 6th and 7th Ave. Several residences in low-lying areas have flooded. There is also water around the north end of the runway. The road east of the Tribal Hall has been breached to reduce water levels and allow water to flow back towards the Yukon River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 PM AKDT, runoff from snowmelt is sending a large volume of water down tributaries feeding the Porcupine River. While the Porcupine and Yukon Rivers continue a slow recession, lingering snow in the basin will continue to melt in very warm conditions. This will lead to continued potential for rising water level in Fort Yukon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon or Porcupine River at Fort Yukon stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
